alert.note: Alert for Blaine; Canadian (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 03 at 9:05PM CDT until June 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River near Watonga affecting Canadian and Blaine Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO EARLY MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Canadian River near Watonga. * WHEN...From this evening to early Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 14.0 feet, Inundation of lowlands near the river may occur. The river reach affected extends from near Watonga in Blaine County... downstream to near Calumet in western Canadian County. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Saturday the stage was 12.4 feet. - Bankfull stage is 13.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 13.9 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning at 915 AM CDT.
